pygqlc package¶

pygqlc.GraphQLClient module¶

class pygqlc.GraphQLClient.GraphQLClient(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

The GraphQLClient class follows the singleton design pattern. It can make a query, mutation or subscription from an api.

environments¶

Dictonary with all envieroments. Defaults to empty dict.

Type

dict

environment¶

Dictionary with the data of the actual enviroment. Defaults to None.

Type

dict

ws_url¶

String with the WSS url. Defaults to None.

Type

string

subs¶

Dictionary with all active subscriptions in the instance. Defaults to empty dict.

Type

dict

sub_counter¶

Count of active subscriptions in the instance. Defaults to 0.

Type

int

sub_router_thread¶

Thread with all subscription logic. Defaults to None.

Type

thread

wss_conn_halted¶

Checks if the wss connection is halted. Defaults to False.

Type

boolean

closing¶

Checks if all subscriptions were successfully closed. Defaults to False.

Type

boolean

unsubscribing¶

Checks if all subscriptions were successfully canceled. Defaults to False.

Type

boolean

websocket_timeout¶

seconds of the websocket timeout. Defaults to 60.

Type

int

Examples

>>> <With> clause:
  '''
  client = GraphQLClient()
  with client.enterEnvironment('dev') as gql:
      data, errors = gql.query('{lines(limit:2){id}}')
      print(data, errors)
  '''
>>> setEnvironment:
  '''
  client = GraphQLClient()
  client.addEnvironment('dev', "https://heineken.valiot.app/")
  client.addHeader(
      environment='dev',
      header={'Authorization': dev_token})
  data, errors = gql.query('{lines(limit:2){id}}')
  print(data, errors)
  '''
addEnvironment(name, url=None, wss=None, headers={}, default=False, timeoutWebsocket=60)¶

This fuction adds a new environment to the instance.

Parameters

  • name (string) – Name of the environment.

  • url (string, optional) – URL of the environmet. Defaults to None.

  • wss (string, optional) – URL of the WSS of the environment. Defaults to None.

  • headers (dict, optional) – A dictionary with the headers (like authorization). Defaults to {}.

  • default (bool, optional) – Checks if the new environment will be the default one of the instance. Defaults to False.

  • timeoutWebsocket (int, optional) – Seconds of the timeout of the websocket. Defaults to 60.

addHeader(environment=None, header={})¶

This function updates the header of an existing environment.

Parameters

  • environment (string, optional) – Name of the environment. Defaults to None.

  • header (dict, optional) – New headers to add. Defaults to {}.

batchMutate(label='mutation')¶

This fuction makes a batchs of mutation transactions.

Parameters

label (str, optional) – Name of the mutation batch. Defaults to ‘mutation’.

Returns

Returns a MutationBatch Object.

Return type

(MutationBatch)

This fuction makes a batchs of query transactions.

Parameters

label (str, optional) – Name of the query batch. Defaults to ‘query’.

Returns

Returns a MutationBatch Object.

close()¶

This function ends and resets all subscriptions and related attributes to their default values.

enterEnvironment(name)¶

This function makes a safe access to an environment.

Parameters

name (string) – Name of the environment.

Returns

Returns self instance for the use with with keyword.

Return type

(self)

execute(query, variables=None)¶

This function executes the intructions of a query or mutation.

Parameters

  • query (string) – Graphql instructions.

  • variables (string, optional) – Variables of the transaction. Defaults to None.

Raises

  • Exception – There is not setted a main environment.

  • Exception – Transactions format error.

Returns

Raw GraphqlResponse.

Return type

[JSON]

mutate(mutation, variables=None, flatten=True)¶

This function makes a mutation transaction to the actual environment.

Parameters

  • mutation (string) – Graphql mutation instructions.

  • variables (string, optional) – Mutation variables. Defaults to None.

  • flatten (bool, optional) – Check if GraphqlResponse should be flatten or not. Defaults to True.

Returns

Returns the GraphqlResponse of the mutation.

Return type

(GraphqlResponse)

query(query, variables=None, flatten=True, single_child=False)¶

This function makes a query transaction to the actual environment.

Parameters

  • query (string) – Graphql query instructions.

  • variables (string, optional) – Query variables. Defaults to None.

  • flatten (bool, optional) – Check if GraphqlResponse should be flatten or not. Defaults to True.

  • single_child (bool, optional) – Check if GraphqlResponse only has one element. Defaults to False.

Returns

Returns the GraphqlResponse of the query.

Return type

(GraphqlResponse)

This function makes a single child query.

Parameters

  • query (string) – Graphql query instructions.

  • variables (string, optional) – Query variables. Defaults to None.

Returns

Returns the GraphqlResponse of the query.

(GraphqlResponse)

Returns

Returns if the reconnection has been possible.

setEnvironment(name)¶

This functions sets the actual environment of the instance.

Parameters

name (string) – Name of the environment.

Raises

Exception – The environment’s name doesn’t exists in the environment list.

setTimeoutWebsocket(seconds)¶

This function sets the webscoket’s timeout.

Parameters

seconds (int) – Time for the timeout.

setUrl(environment=None, url=None)¶

This function sets a new url to an existing environment.

Parameters

  • environment (string, optional) – Name of the environment. Defaults to None.

  • url (string, optional) – New URL for the enviroment. Defaults to None.

setWss(environment=None, url=None)¶

This function sets a new WSS to an existing environment.

Parameters

  • environment (string, optional) – Name of the environment. Defaults to None.

  • url (string, optional) – New WSS URL for the environment. Defaults to None.

subscribe(query, variables=None, callback=None, flatten=True, _id=None)¶

This functions makes a subscription to the actual environment.

Parameters

  • query (string) – Graphql subscription instructions.

  • variables (string, optional) – Subscription variables. Defaults to None.

  • callback (function, optional) – Trigger function of the subscription. Defaults to None.

  • flatten (bool, optional) – Check if GraphqlResponse should be flatten or not. Defaults to True.

  • _id (int, optional) – Subscription id. Defaults to None.

Returns

Returns the GraphqlResponse of the subscription.

Return type

(GraphqlResponse)

This function formats the data structure of a GqlResponse.

Parameters

  • data (dict, list) – The data of a GqlResponse.

  • single_child (bool, optional) – Checks if the data has only one element.

  • to False. (Defaults) –

Returns

Returns a formatted data.

Return type

(dict)

pygqlc.GraphQLClient.has_errors(result)¶

This function checks if a GqlResponse has any errors.

Parameters

result (GqlResponse) – [data, errors]

Returns

Returns True if a transaction has at least one error.

Return type

(boolean)

pygqlc.GraphQLClient.safe_pop(data, index=0, default=None)¶

This function pops safetly a GqlResponse from a subscription queue.

Parameters

  • data (list) – Is the list of GqlResponse that caught the subscription.

  • index (int, optional) – Index of the subscription queue. Defaults to 0.

  • default (None, optional) – Define the default message. Defaults to None.

Returns

Returns the GqlResponse. If the subscription queue is

empty, it returns the default message.

Return type

[GqlResponse]

pygqlc.MutationBatch module¶

exception pygqlc.MutationBatch.InvalidMutationException¶

Bases: Exception

This class is to define the InvalidMutationException

class pygqlc.MutationBatch.MutationBatch(client=None, label='mutation')¶

Bases: object

This is the mutation batch class, it can generate and execute a batch of graphql’s transaction.

Parameters

  • client (GraphQLClient Object, optional) – Instance of the GraphQLClient. Defaults to None.

  • label (str, optional) – Label that will get each transaction of the batch. Defaults to ‘mutation’.

Examples

>>> Batch example:
  with gql.batchMutate(label='mut') as batch:
    for author in authors:
      batch.add(
        muts.create_author, {
          'name': author['name']
        }
      )
    data, errors = batch.execute()
    print(data)

>>> Mutation simple example:
  mutation {
    label_1: mutationName(
      param1: valx
      param2: valy
    ){
      response1
    }
    label_2: mutationName2(
      param1: valz
    ){
      response2
    }
  }

>>> Mutation complex example:
  mutation MutationAlias(
    >>>$param1: Type1
    $param2: Type2
    $param3: Type3
    ){
    label_1: mutationName(
      param1: $param1
      param2: $param2
    ){
      response1
    }
    label_2: mutationName2(
      param1: $param3
    ){
      response2
    }
  }
append(doc, variables={})¶

This function makes each transactions for the batch.

Parameters

  • doc (string) – GraphQL transaction intructions.

  • variables (dict, optional) – Variables of the transaction. Defaults to {}.

Raises

InvalidMutationException – It raises when the doc is invalid.

This function can execute a TransactionBatch.

Returns

Returns the Graphql response.

Return type

(GraphqlResponse)

This function builds the transaction.

Returns

Returns the full transaction, ready to execute.

Return type

(string)

transaction regex.
